Authors:
Alejandra Giraldo, Josepa Gene, Josep Cano, G. Sybren De
Hoog, Josep Guarro
Title: Two new species of Acremonium from Spanish soils
Abstract:
In a survey on the diversity of microfungi in Spanish
soils, two new species of Acremonium were found. Both species were
characterized mainly by having conidiophores more or less erect, mostly
branched, with branch bearing whorls of acicular phialides. In addition,
one of these species, Acremonium chlamydosporum, produced abundant
chlamydospores and globose rough-walled conidia. The other species,
Acremonium variecolor, produced a brownish diffusible pigment and
smooth, subglobose with apiculate base conidia; sessile conidia growing
directly from vegetative hyphae were also present The analysis of the
sequences of the ITS region, the D1-D2 domains of the 28S rRNA gene and
a fragment of the actin gene revealed their relationships with members
of the Hypocreales and demonstrated their genetic differences with
morphologically similar species
